title: Finland further delays Picasso entry to end March
subtitle: (Montel) Finland has further delayed joining EU-wide power balancing platform Picasso to 26 March.
body:
“The technical challenges in the implementation of the data transfer, which delayed the connection, have been resolved and Fingrid is moving towards deployment,” the TSO said in a statement late on Monday.
Once its neighbours joined the platform as well – with Estonia likely to be the first – the country would start trading balancing power across its borders, added Fingrid.
Finland had originally planned to join in May last year but has repeatedly postponed its entry, citing IT challenges.
Last week, Norway postponed its entry to 2026 or 2027.
The Picasso platform was launched in 2022 with the aim of supporting balancing markets by sharing capacity between European countries, though last year a number of nations delayed entry amid concerns the algorithm caused price spikes.
